text: Alfred Kotey (3 June 1968 â€“ 30 June 2020) was a Ghanaian professional boxer. He was born in Accra. He competed from 1988 to 2012. He held the WBO bantamweight title from 1994 to 1995 and at regional level the Commonwealth flyweight title from 1989 to 1990. He represented Ghana at the 1988 Summer Olympics. Kotey died on 30 June 2020 in New York City from stroke-related problems, aged 52. ==References== Category:1968 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Accra Category:Boxers Category:Olympians for Ghana Category:Deaths from stroke
title: Alfred Kotey
